In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the letter **N** serves the following purposes:

- n represents a [nymph](/wiki/Nymph "Nymph"):

  - n wood nymph
  - n water nymph
  - n mountain nymph

* N represents a [naga](/wiki/Naga "Naga"):

  - N red naga
  - N black naga
  - N golden naga
  - N guardian naga
  - N red naga hatchling
  - N black naga hatchling
  - N golden naga hatchling
  - N guardian naga hatchling

- It is also used as a [direction](/wiki/Direction "Direction") key if [numpad](/wiki/Numpad "Numpad") movement is off:

  - Press [n]() to move south-east.
  - Press [shift](/wiki/Shift "Shift") + [n]() to move far south-east.

* If numpad movement is on:

  - Pressing [n]() lets you specify a [numeric prefix](/wiki/Numeric_prefix "Numeric prefix") for a command. For example, `n10s` would [search](/wiki/Search "Search") 10 times.
  - Pressing [shift](/wiki/Shift "Shift") + [n]() works as an alias for the [extended command](/wiki/Extended_command "Extended command") #[name](/wiki/Name "Name").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Historical uses](#Historical_uses)

- [2 Variants](#Variants)

  - [2.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [2.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [2.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [2.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [2.5 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

## Historical uses

In Hack 1.21, a variant of [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), the neevil used the n glyph, while the nepto used the N glyph; in the variant Hack for PDP-11, the n glyph is instead given to the neo-otyugh, while the N glyph was given to the nymph.

From [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0") to [NetHack 2.3e](/wiki/NetHack_2.3e "NetHack 2.3e"), nymphs used the N glyph, while [nurses](/wiki/Nurse "Nurse") used the n glyph. In [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), nagas were introduced and represented by the N glyph, while the nymph was split into its three subtypes and moved to the n glyph; nurses were moved to the @ glyph with other [human and elven monsters](/wiki/Human_or_elf "Human or elf").

## Variants

Many variants introduce [Aphrodite](/wiki/Aphrodite "Aphrodite"), a new unique monster that use the n glyph.

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") introduces new monsters that use the n glyph:

- n nymph:

  - n [pixie](/wiki/Pixie "Pixie")
  - n [brownie](/wiki/Brownie "Brownie")
  - n [quickling](/wiki/Quickling "Quickling")
  - n [Aphrodite](/wiki/Aphrodite "Aphrodite")

### UnNetHack

[UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") introduces new monsters that use the n and N glyphs:

- n nymph:
  - n [Aphrodite](/wiki/Aphrodite "Aphrodite")

- N naga:

  - N [white naga](/wiki/White_naga "White naga")
  - N [white naga hatchling](/wiki/White_naga_hatchling "White naga hatchling")

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") renames and changes the three nymphs from vanilla, and adds several other monsters that use the n and N glyphs:

- n nymph:

  - n [quickling](/wiki/Quickling "Quickling")
  - n [dryad](/wiki/Dryad "Dryad")
  - n [naiad](/wiki/Naiad "Naiad")
  - n [oread](/wiki/Oread "Oread")
  - n [swamp nymph](/wiki/Swamp_nymph "Swamp nymph")
  - n [yuki-onna](/wiki/Yuki-onna_\(dNetHack\) "Yuki-onna (dNetHack)")
  - n [deminymph](/wiki/Deminymph "Deminymph")
  - n [neverwas](/wiki/Neverwas "Neverwas")
  - n [thriae](/wiki/Thriae "Thriae")
  - n [selkie](/wiki/Selkie_\(dNetHack\) "Selkie (dNetHack)")
  - n [oceanid](/wiki/Oceanid "Oceanid")
  - n [intoner](/wiki/Intoner "Intoner")
  - n [Aglaope](/wiki/Aglaope "Aglaope")
  - n [Nimune](/wiki/Nimune "Nimune")
  - Unused nymphs:
    - n [Echo](/index.php?title=Echo\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Echo (page does not exist)")

- N naga:
  - N [ancient naga](/wiki/Ancient_naga "Ancient naga")

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") also contains Aphrodite and her nymph level, and adds a couple of other monsters that use the n glyph:

- n nymph:

  - n [ice nymph](/wiki/Ice_nymph "Ice nymph")
  - n [nymph](/index.php?title=Nymph_\(EvilHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Nymph (EvilHack) (page does not exist)")

### SlashTHEM

[SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") retains the nymphs added in SLASH'EM, and adds several other monsters that use the n and N glyphs, including some from other variants:

- n nymph:

  - n [nymph](/index.php?title=Nymph_\(SlashTHEM\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Nymph (SlashTHEM) (page does not exist)")
  - n [satyr](/wiki/Satyr "Satyr")
  - n [nymph queen](/index.php?title=Nymph_queen\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Nymph queen (page does not exist)")

- N naga:

  - N [blue naga hatchling](/index.php?title=Blue_naga_hatchling\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Blue naga hatchling (page does not exist)")
  - N [white naga hatchling](/wiki/White_naga_hatchling "White naga hatchling")
  - N [blue naga](/index.php?title=Blue_naga\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Blue naga (page does not exist)")
  - N [white naga](/wiki/White_naga "White naga")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

N

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt

In NetHack, the letter N serves the following purposes:

  • n represents a nymph:
    • n wood nymph
    • n water nymph
    • n mountain nymph
  • N represents a naga:
    • N red naga
    • N black naga
    • N golden naga
    • N guardian naga
    • N red naga hatchling
    • N black naga hatchling
    • N golden naga hatchling
    • N guardian naga hatchling
  • It is also used as a direction key if numpad movement is off:
    • Press n to move south-east.
    • Press shift + n to move far south-east.
  • If numpad movement is on:
    • Pressing n lets you specify a numeric prefix for a command. For example, n10s would search 10 times.
    • Pressing shift + n works as an alias for the extended command #name.

Contents

  • 1 Historical uses
  • 2 Variants
    • 2.1 SLASH'EM
    • 2.2 UnNetHack
    • 2.3 dNetHack
    • 2.4 EvilHack
    • 2.5 SlashTHEM

Historical uses

In Hack 1.21, a variant of Jay Fenlason's Hack, the neevil used the n glyph, while the nepto used the N glyph; in the variant Hack for PDP-11, the n glyph is instead given to the neo-otyugh, while the N glyph was given to the nymph.

From Hack 1.0 to NetHack 2.3e, nymphs used the N glyph, while nurses used the n glyph. In NetHack 3.0.0, nagas were introduced and represented by the N glyph, while the nymph was split into its three subtypes and moved to the n glyph; nurses were moved to the @ glyph with other human and elven monsters.

Variants

Many variants introduce Aphrodite, a new unique monster that use the n glyph.

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM introduces new monsters that use the n glyph:

  • n nymph:
    • n pixie
    • n brownie
    • n quickling
    • n Aphrodite

UnNetHack

UnNetHack introduces new monsters that use the n and N glyphs:

  • n nymph:
    • n Aphrodite
  • N naga:
    • N white naga
    • N white naga hatchling

dNetHack

dNetHack renames and changes the three nymphs from vanilla, and adds several other monsters that use the n and N glyphs:

  • n nymph:
    • n quickling
    • n dryad
    • n naiad
    • n oread
    • n swamp nymph
    • n yuki-onna
    • n deminymph
    • n neverwas
    • n thriae
    • n selkie
    • n oceanid
    • n intoner
    • n Aglaope
    • n Nimune
    • Unused nymphs:
      • n Echo
  • N naga:
    • N ancient naga

EvilHack

EvilHack also contains Aphrodite and her nymph level, and adds a couple of other monsters that use the n glyph:

  • n nymph:
    • n ice nymph
    • n nymph

SlashTHEM

SlashTHEM retains the nymphs added in SLASH'EM, and adds several other monsters that use the n and N glyphs, including some from other variants:

  • n nymph:
    • n nymph
    • n satyr
    • n nymph queen
  • N naga:
    • N blue naga hatchling
    • N white naga hatchling
    • N blue naga
    • N white naga

rawPage:
{{ASCII}}
In ''[[NetHack]]'', the letter '''N''' serves the following purposes:

* {{white|n}} represents a [[nymph]]:
** {{monsym|wood nymph}} wood nymph
** {{monsym|water nymph}} water nymph
** {{monsym|mountain nymph}} mountain nymph

* {{white|N}} represents a [[naga]]:
** {{monsym|red naga}} red naga
** {{monsym|black naga}} black naga
** {{monsym|golden naga}} golden naga
** {{monsym|guardian naga}} guardian naga
** {{monsym|red naga hatchling}} red naga hatchling
** {{monsym|black naga hatchling}} black naga hatchling
** {{monsym|golden naga hatchling}} golden naga hatchling
** {{monsym|guardian naga hatchling}} guardian naga hatchling

* It is also used as a [[direction]] key if [[numpad]] movement is off:
** Press {{kbd|n}} to move south-east.
** Press {{kbd|shift|n}} to move far south-east.

* If numpad movement is on:
** Pressing {{kbd|n}} lets you specify a [[numeric prefix]] for a command. For example, <tt>n10s</tt> would [[search]] 10 times.
** Pressing {{kbd|shift|n}} works as an alias for the [[extended command]] #[[name]].

==Historical uses==
In Hack 1.21, a variant of [[Jay Fenlason's Hack]], the neevil used the {{white|n}} glyph, while the nepto used the {{white|N}} glyph; in the variant Hack for PDP-11, the {{white|n}} glyph is instead given to the neo-otyugh, while the {{white|N}} glyph was given to the nymph.

From [[Hack 1.0]] to [[NetHack 2.3e]], nymphs used the {{white|N}} glyph, while [[nurse]]s used the {{white|n}} glyph. In [[NetHack 3.0.0]], nagas were introduced and represented by the {{white|N}} glyph, while the nymph was split into its three subtypes and moved to the {{white|n}} glyph; nurses were moved to the {{white|@}} glyph with other [[Human or elf|human and elven monsters]].

==Variants==
Many variants introduce [[Aphrodite]], a new unique monster that use the {{white|n}} glyph.

===SLASH'EM===
[[SLASH'EM]] introduces new monsters that use the {{white|n}} glyph:

* {{white|n}} nymph:
** {{monsymlink|pixie}}
** {{monsymlink|brownie}}
** {{monsymlink|quickling}}
** {{monsymlink|Aphrodite}}

===UnNetHack===
[[UnNetHack]] introduces new monsters that use the {{white|n}} and {{white|N}} glyphs:

* {{white|n}} nymph:
** {{monsymlink|Aphrodite}}
* {{white|N}} naga:
** {{monsymlink|white naga}}
** {{monsymlink|white naga hatchling}}

===dNetHack===
[[dNetHack]] renames and changes the three nymphs from vanilla, and adds several other monsters that use the {{white|n}} and {{white|N}} glyphs:

* {{white|n}} nymph:
** {{brightblue|n}} [[quickling]]
** {{green|n}} [[dryad]]
** {{blue|n}} [[naiad]]
** {{brown|n}} [[oread]]
** {{magenta|n}} [[swamp nymph]]
** {{brightcyan|n}} [[Yuki-onna (dNetHack)|yuki-onna]]
** {{white|n}} [[deminymph]]
** {{red|n}} [[neverwas]]
** {{yellow|n}} [[thriae]]
** {{brown|n}} [[Selkie (dNetHack)|selkie]]
** {{blue|n}} [[oceanid]]
** {{brightmagenta|n}} [[intoner]]
** {{magenta|n}} [[Aglaope]]
** {{magenta|n}} [[Nimune]]
** Unused nymphs:
*** {{brightgreen|n}} [[Echo]]
* {{white|N}} naga:
** {{magenta|N}} [[ancient naga]]

===EvilHack===
[[EvilHack]] also contains Aphrodite and her nymph level, and adds a couple of other monsters that use the {{white|n}} glyph:

* {{white|n}} nymph:
** {{brightcyan|n}} [[ice nymph]]
** {{cyan|n}} [[Nymph (EvilHack)|nymph]]

===SlashTHEM===
[[SlashTHEM]] retains the nymphs added in SLASH'EM, and adds several other monsters that use the {{white|n}} and {{white|N}} glyphs, including some from other variants:

* {{white|n}} nymph:
** {{brown|n}} [[Nymph (SlashTHEM)|nymph]] 
** {{brown|n}} [[satyr]]
** {{magenta|n}} [[nymph queen]]
* {{white|N}} naga:
** {{blue|N}} [[blue naga hatchling]]
** {{monsymlink|white naga hatchling}}
** {{blue|N}} [[blue naga]]
** {{monsymlink|white naga}}
{{nethack-367}}
